Name.BusinessNameLine1: National Center for Children and Families Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO CREATE TOTAL, HEALTHY LIVING ENVIRONMENTS FOR VULNERABLE CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES AND THE QUALITY OF LIFE THAT EMPOWERS THEIR ABILITY TO THRIVE AND DEMONSTRATE RESPONSIBILITY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT TOTAL, HEALTHY LIVING ENVIRONMENTS FOR VULNERABLE CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, AND THE QUALITY OF LIFE WHICH EMPOWERS THEIR ABILITY TO THRIVE AND DEMONSTRATE RESPONSIBILITY.
IRS990.Description: INNOVATIVE FAMILY CONNECTIONS - FOSTER CARE PROGRAMS PROVIDE TRADITIONAL AND SPECIALIZED TREATMENT ALTERNATIVES TO INSTITUTIONALIZATION BY MATCHING CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS WITH FAMILIES WHO CAN GIVE THEM THE TIME, LOVE AND ATTENTION THEY NEED TO GROW INTO HEALTHY ADULTS. THROUGH THE RECRUTIMENT, TRAINING AND CAREFUL MATCHING OF SPECIALIZED FOSTER CARE PARENTS, CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS RECEIVE INDIVIDUALIZED CARE IN TEMPORARY YET NURTURING HOMES. LICENSED CAPACITY IS 103 CHILDREN AND YOUTH AGES BIRTH TO 21 YEARS.

Activity2.Description: GREENTREE ADOLESCENT PROGRAM - "GAP" PROVIDES 24-HOUR RESIDENTIAL CARE AND COMPREHENSIVE THERAPUTIC SERVICES TO YOUTH WHO HAVE BEEN MALTREATED AND/OR PRESENT BEHAVIOR MANAGMENT PROBLEMS. THROUGH SPECIALIZED TREATMENT, GAP ADDRESSES THEIR EDUCATIONAL, MEDICAL, MENTAL HEALTH, RECREATIONAL AND SOCIAL NEEDS. YOUTH WHO SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE THE PROGRAM EITHER RETURN TO THEIR BIOLOGICAL FAMILY, JOIN A THERAPEUTIC FOSTER FAMILY, OR TRANSITION INTO AN INDEPENDENT LIVING PROGRAM. LICENSED CAPACITY OF 20 ADOLESCENT MALES AND FEMALES AGED 13 - 20 YEARS.

Activity3.Description: GREENTREE SHELTER - SHELTER FOR HOMELSS FAMILIES, WITH ON-SITE CHILDCARE CENTER AND THE CAPACITY TO ACCOMMODATE TWO-PARENT FAMILIES. AT "GTS", FAMILIES RECEIVE COUNSELING, PARENTING EDUCATION, SUBSTANCE ABUSE EDUCATION, SKILLS TRAINING, EMPLOYMENT ASSISTANCE, MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES AND GED CLASSES TO HELP THEM REGAIN THEIR SELF-ESTEEM AND THE LIFE SKILLS NEEDED TO FIND HOUSING AND AVOID THE RECURRENCE OF HOMELESSNESS. LICENSED CAPACITY IS 46 BEDS FOR HOMELESS FAMILIES AND INCLUDES 2 YEARS OF AFTERCARE SUPPORT TO PREVENT RECIDIVISM.

ActivityOther.Description: BETTY ANN KRAHNKE CENTER FOR NEW BEGINNINGS (BAK) - A DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SHELTER FOR WOMAN AND CHILDREN RECOVERING FROM FAMILY ABUSE. AS THE LARGEST DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SHELTER IN MD, BAK'S 24-HOUR SECURITY, ON-SITE CHILDCARE AND THERAPEUTIC SERVICES EMPOWER WOMEN TO CREATE A NEW FUTURE FOR THEMSELVES AND THEIR FAMILIES, ONE THAT IS FREE OF ABUSE, COERCION AND FEAR. SERVES 200 CHILDREN, 170 ADULTS, 105 FAMILES.

FUTUREBOUND INDEPENDENT LIVING - SUPERVISED APARTMENT-BASED PROGRAM FOR YOUTH WHO ARE AGING OUT OF THE CARE OF PUBLIC SYSTEMS AND NEED TRANSITIONAL ASSISTANCE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THE COMMUNITY. WE PROVIDE 24 HOUR, COMPREHENSIVE SUPERVISION AND SKILLS TRAINING AND SUPPORT. TWENTY-ONE MALE AND FEMALE YOUNG ADULT LICENSED CAPACITY.

JC NALLE COMMUNITY SCHOOL - FULL SERVICE COMMUNITY SCHOOL PROGRAM, BASED ON A PARTNERSHIP IN 1995 WITH THE FREDDIE MAC FOUNDATION AND THE DC PUBLIC SCHOOLS. WE OFFER EXTENDED INSTRUCTIONAL, MENTAL HEALTH, AND SOCIAL SUPPORTS TO ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS IN WARD 7 TO HELP THEM ACHEIVE ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE.
MD TREATMENT FOSTER CARE - PROVIDES TEMPORARY FAMILY CARE FOR CHILDREN WITH MENTAL HEALTH DISABILITIES, AGES 6 TO 21, WHO NEED A STABLE HOME. SERVED 29 CHILDREN AND YOUTH - 7 FAMILIES.

FAMILY STABILIZATION PROGRAM - SERVED 106 CHILDREN, 60 ADULTS, 56 FAMILIES. FOUNDED IN 1989, THIS IS AN 18-MONTH SUBSIDIZED TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAM FOR HOMELESS FAMILIES IN MONTGOMERY COUNTY, MARYLAND, PROVIDING ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT, HEALTHCARE, PARENT EDUCATION, MENTAL HEALTH, DRUG TREATMENT, AND CHILD CARE SERVICES.
CARA HOUSE - FOUNDED IN 1997, CARA HOUSE IS A COUMMUNITY-BASED, COLLABORATIVE, THERAPEUTIC PARENTING EDUCATION CENTER IN WARD 7 IN WASHINGTON, DC. SERVED 327 CHILDREN, 492 ADULTS AND 171 FAMILIES.

GREENTREE SCHOOL PROGRAM - FOUNDED IN 1993, IS AN APPROVED TYPE III EDUCATION DAY SCHOOL FOR NEWLY PLACED GREENTREE ADOLESCENT PROGRAM (GAP) RESIDENTS IN TRANSITION TO NEW PUBLIC SCHOOL PLACEMENTS. LICENSED CAPACITY IS SIX ADOLESCENTS, MALE AND FEMALE AGES 13-20.
INNOVATIVE FAMILY CONNECTIONS II - PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE CARE TO FAMILIES UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE DC SUPERIOR COURT DUE TO CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT.
RAPID REHOUSING - PROVIDES TRANSITIONAL HOUSING ASSISTANCE FOR OUR VULNERABLE POPULATION.
BETTY'S HOUSE - PROVIDES EMERGENCY CARE AND SHELTER FOR ABUSED INDIVIDUALS.

LoanTable.PurposeOfLoan: MORTGAGE COLLATERALIZED BY 13 ACRES OF LAND

NameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: MONTGOMERY COUNTY DEPT OF HSG & COMM DEV
MONTGOMERY COUNTY DEPT OF HSG & COMM DEV

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COPIES OF THE 990 ARE PROVIDED TO THE BOARD BEFORE FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HOLDS FREQUENT BOARD MEETINGS. CONFLICT OF INTERETS POLICIES ARE DISCUSSED AT THE ANNUAL MEETING. ANY CONFLICTS ARE TO BE DISCLOSED AT THE REGULAR BOARD MEETINGS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE EVALUATES COMPENSATION SURVEY AND USES KNOWLEDGE OF SIMILAR POSTIONS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES ITS ANNUAL REPORT ON ITS WEBSITE AND ALSO LISTS ITS CONTACT INFORMATION FOR ITS EXECUTIVE LEADERSHIP AND DIVISION MANAGERS.
